info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 31 at 12:16AM PDT until April 1 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, west winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. For the second Wind Advisory, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected.
* WHERE...Western Imperial County, and Imperial Valley.
* WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 11 PM PDT this evening. For the second Wind Advisory, from 3 PM to 11 PM PDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction:
A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

parameter.value: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM TO 11 PM PDT TUESDAY
